item.title: Installation and Basic Setup
item.description: Installing Node.js # To get started with electron, you need to install Node.js. Go to nodejs.org/en/download/ and download the LTS or Long Term Support version. Once its downloaded, install node.js on your system. Verify Installation # Once you have installed node.js, you can test your installation by running the following commands in the terminal. node -v npm -v On running these you should be able to see the versions of node.

item.title: Displaying Todos
item.description: Now that we have electron setup, let us start displaying some todos. Modifying index.html # To get started let us modify the html file so that we can start adding todos. Let us add a title and a div which can store the todos. Replace the body of index.html with the following: <h1>Todo List</h1> <div id="todos"></div> In electron, the main script file (in our case main.js) cannot directly access and modify the html page.

item.title: Adding Todos
item.description: Now let us add some functionality to add some todos. Adding text box and button # First, let us add a button and a textbox where we can enter and add todos. We can do this by adding the following lines of code to the body of our html just below the div which contains the todos. <input id="add-inp" type="text" /> <button id="add-btn">Add</button> Also let us change the title to say To-do list app.

item.title: Enabling Data Persistence
item.description: At this point you might have noticed that after adding any todos, if you restart your application, the todos don’t stay. To do this we will need to store your todos to memory. There are 2-ways in which you can store data to disk. Firstly, we can use a database. However, this involves complex setup and maintenance. The second way to do this is to store our data directly to a file.

item.title: Adding Bootstrap
item.description: As a final step to our project let use the bootstrap css library to make our app look appealing. If you don’t really know what bootstrap is, it is a css library which allows you to quickly create beautiful websites. You can read more about it here. Installing the bootstrap library # First, let us install the bootstrap library. Run the following command to install the bootstrap library: npm install bootstrap --save Linking bootstrap to index.

item.title: Packaging Application
item.description: In order to package and distribute your electron application, you can use Electron Forge. Installing Electron Forge # Run the following command to install electron forge: npm install --save-dev @electron-forge/cli npx electron-forge import Package Application # To build your application for distribution, run the command: npm run make This will create a folder called out which contains your application ready for distribution.
